title: Introducing: Letters To Lions
content:
Australian (Sydney to be precise) quartet Letters To Lions sound ready made to headline festivals.

Combining elements of almost every ‘indie’ festival headliner from the past four or five years (we’re talking Kings of Leon, The Killers, Foals, Tame Impala), it’s been a while since I heard a band with such obviously ambitious aspirations, and that’s meant in entirely the best way. YETI sounds like WU LYF covering Kings Of Leon, whilst This Morning is the set opener that Tame Impala have been looking for over the past year. It’s in your face, it’s bold, it’s completely unashamed in it’s commercial nature, and, above all, Letters To Lions are bloody brilliant.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
